revised_title: Mimetic Forms of Butterflies in the Genus Hypolimnas
tldr: The author investigates the changes in species of a group of butterflies as they move between localities and explores the impact of these changes on the theory of mimicry. The study provides strong evidence for the theory of mimicry proposed by H. W. Bates and sheds light on various aspects of evolutionary biology, such as the role of females in mimicry, the ancestral form of the butterflies, and the conditions under which mimicry appears in closely-related species.
